intro: Scaligeria setacea, commonly known as the hairy scaligeria, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, white to greenish flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or coastal areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
